titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Aristide Cavaillé-Coll papers, 1833-1885, 1970s RL.10022
titlestmt.author: Molly Bragg

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2015-07-29 15:53:32 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Aristide Caviallé-Coll was a French organ builder and musician. The collection includes unbound, full-size prints from microfilm of letters, monographs, first drafts, contracts, and indexes which reflect the extent of Caviallé-Coll's work in France, Europe, and the Americas, as well as his incorporation of technological innovations into his instruments. This material was used by Professor Fenner Douglass in his book "Caviallé-Coll and the Musicians; a Documented Account of the First Thirty Years in Organ Building," and includes the author's index cards and notebooks.
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Aristide Caviallé-Coll was a French organ builder and musician.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The collection includes unbound, full-size prints from microfilm of letters, monographs, first drafts, contracts, and indexes which reflect the extent of Caviallé-Coll's work in France, Europe and the Americas, as well as his incorporations of technological innovations into his instruments. The material in this collection was used by Professor Fenner Douglass in his book "Caviallé-Coll and the Musicians; a Documented Account of the First Thirty Years in Organ Building," and the collection includes the author's index cards and notebooks.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Aristide Caviallé-Coll papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library in several accessions as a gift beginning in 1979.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48-hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Aristide Caviallé-Coll papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.
